question_details.title: Will the temperature reach 90 degrees F in Miami FL after the launch of this question and before April 1, 2025?
question_details.description: An introduction to the National Weather Service's Automated Surface Observing System can be found [here](https://www.weather.gov/asos/).
question_details.resolution_criteria: This question resolves as **Yes** if the high temperature in Miami FL (specifically Miami International Airport), as presented by [Iowa Environmental Mesonet](https://mesonet.agron.iastate.edu/sites/hist.phtml?station=MIA&network=FL_ASOS), has a high of greater than or equal to 90 degrees Fahrenheit for any day after the launch of this question and before April 1, 2025.

news:
Here are the relevant news articles:

**Mostly sunny and dry across South Florida**
South Florida is expected to be mostly sunny and dry on Wednesday, with temperatures in the upper 50s and low 60s in the morning. A brush fire in southern Miami-Dade has forced the closure of Card Sound Road, and the wind will play a role in determining where the smoke will move. Rain is not expected to help with the containment of the fire, and it will be mainly dry and sunny in the afternoon with highs in the low 80s. There is a moderate risk of rip currents along the Atlantic beaches. Thursday will be the warmest day of the week, with highs in the mid 80s, but it will be breezy. The weekend will be warmer, with highs in the low 80s, and early next week the chance of rain increases with spotty showers on Monday and scattered showers on Tuesday.
Original language: en
Publish date: March 19, 2025 12:21 PM
Source:[CBS News](https://www.cbsnews.com/miami/news/mostly-sunny-and-dry-across-south-florida/)

**Vilfand Predicts Up to 14 Degrees Celsius in Moscow Next Week**
Roman Vilfand, the scientific director of the Russian Hydrometeorological Center, has predicted that the temperature in Moscow may reach up to 14 degrees Celsius next week. 'The temperature will be above 10 degrees Celsius on March 23 and 24, with daytime temperatures ranging from +6 to +11 degrees Celsius. It will be sunny due to high pressure, and the air masses will be moving from the south,' Vilfand said. He added that on March 25, daytime temperatures are expected to range from +9 to +14 degrees Celsius, with mostly clear skies and little precipitation. 'There will be plenty of sunshine in the coming days, and if you stand outside for an hour, you might even get a sunburn,' Vilfand concluded. This comes after Tatyana Pozdnyakova, the chief specialist at the Moscow Meteorological Bureau, predicted that April will be 3 degrees warmer than normal in Moscow. Vilfand also previously stated that spring 2025 temperatures will be within or slightly below normal, and that the winter of 2024-2025 was the second warmest on record.
Original language: ru
Publish date: March 19, 2025 12:15 PM
Source:[Izvestia.ru](https://iz.ru/1856652/2025-03-19/vilfand-sprognoziroval-do-14-gradusov-tepla-v-moskve-na-sleduiushchei-nedele)

**What will weather be like during Easter school holidays in Scotland as experts tease 'hottest ever' April - Daily Record**
Experts predict that this April could be the 'hottest ever' in the UK, with a 20% chance of it being the planet's hottest ever April. The Met Office's long-range forecast suggests that it will be dry with average temperatures, but there is a possibility of wetter episodes. Daytime maximum temperatures are expected to be around 11C, but some experts believe it could reach 27 degrees in parts of the UK. However, there is also a 17% chance of it being the UK's wettest ever April. Shane Orton from betideas.com said, 'From June 2023 to June 2024, the globe saw the hottest ever months 13 times in a row - so it's incredibly likely that it will be the same story next month.' 
Original language: en
Publish date: March 19, 2025 09:47 AM
Source:[Daily Record](https://www.dailyrecord.co.uk/lifestyle/what-weather-like-during-easter-34888681)

**Russia's April Weather Forecast: Warmer Than Usual**
According to a forecast by Moscow's meteorological office, temperatures in the Central Federal District (CFO) are expected to be three degrees warmer than usual. As meteorologist Tatyana Pozdnyakova said, 'This means that the average monthly air temperature will exceed 10 degrees Celsius. April 2025 will have a similar air temperature to April 2024.' 
Original language: ru
Publish date: March 19, 2025 07:26 AM
Source:[RZN.info](https://www.rzn.info/news/2025/3/19/rossiyanam-dali-prognoz-aprelskoj-pogody-v-cfo-313899.html)

**April in Moscow to be Abnormally Warm, Says Meteorologist Tatyana Podynyakova**
According to meteorologist Tatyana Podynyakova, April in Moscow will be abnormally warm, with a mean monthly temperature above +10°C. 'All seasonal weather forecast models are unanimous in their calculations: a positive temperature anomaly will persist in April, averaging around +3°C. This means that the mean monthly temperature will exceed +10°C,' she wrote in her Telegram channel. Podynyakova notes that April this year will be similar to April 2024 in terms of temperature. However, the forecast for precipitation is uncertain, with both a deficit and an excess being equally likely. Last year, April saw an excess of precipitation, with 37 mm of normal precipitation exceeded by 130-150%.
Original language: ru
Publish date: March 19, 2025 06:20 AM
Source:[Российская газета](https://rg.ru/2025/03/19/reg-cfo/sinoptik-pozdniakova-v-aprele-anomalno-teplaia-pogoda-v-moskve-sohranitsia.html)

**April 2025: Temperatures Above Average, but Extreme Weather Events Possible**
According to the latest updates, April 2025 is expected to start with temperatures above the average, with deviations of +2-3°C from the reference values on most of Europe's central and eastern regions, as well as Scandinavia. Italy is also expected to experience temperatures above the average, with deviations of +1 to +3°C from the mean. However, this does not mean that there will be constant sunshine and warm weather. Powerful meridian exchanges are possible, which could bring rapid and significant changes in the weather, including late-season cold fronts and extreme weather events such as violent storms, tornadoes, and heavy rain. The first decade of April is expected to see above-average precipitation in Italy, with the possibility of snow on the mountains. Only in the second part of the month, around Easter (April 20), is there a chance of greater atmospheric stability in Italy, although this will be updated in future articles. The spring season is expected to be extreme, with a succession of unstable and unpredictable weather patterns.
Original language: it
Publish date: March 18, 2025 05:00 PM
Source:[ILMETEO.it](https://www.ilmeteo.it/notizie/meteo-aprile-sotto-la-pioggia-ecco-la-prima-tendenza-fino-a-pasqua-180002)

**Possible First Summer Day of 2025: Temperatures to Reach Up to 25 Degrees Celsius**
A meteorologist, Dominik Jung, predicts that it could be the first summer day of the year 2025 on Friday, with temperatures reaching up to 25 degrees Celsius. According to the German Weather Service (DWD), a summer day is defined as a day with a minimum air temperature of 25 degrees Celsius. Jung says that it will be unusually warm for the season, with temperatures in the west and southwest reaching up to 20 degrees Celsius, and locally even warmer. In the east, temperatures will reach up to 21 degrees Celsius, and in the north, up to 18 degrees Celsius. Jung also notes that the sun will shine brightly throughout the country, with 10-12 hours of sunshine per day. However, a high-pressure system called 'Konstantina' will bring Saharan dust to the country, which may cloud the sky in the west on Friday. Despite this, temperatures are expected to remain warm over the weekend, with values of 15-22 degrees Celsius predicted for Saturday and Sunday. Jung notes that it is still unclear how the weather will develop in April and May, and that cold air masses may still occur.
Original language: de
Publish date: March 18, 2025 02:14 PM
Source:[T-online.de](https://www.t-online.de/nachrichten/panorama/wetter/id_100641434/wetter-bis-zu-25-grad-diese-woche-erster-sommertag-moeglich.html)

**Unseasonable Heat Wave to Hit Leningrad Region in April**
A synoptician has predicted that April 2025 in the Leningrad region will bring an unusual heat wave, with daytime temperatures reaching +20 degrees Celsius from the beginning of the month and potentially exceeding +25 degrees Celsius by the second half of the month. This will lead to an early awakening of nature and infrastructure in the region. While the early warmth brings pleasant prospects, it may also have negative consequences, such as early tree blooming, which can cause problems for people with allergies, and an increase in forest fires due to dry soil. However, for gardeners, this will be a welcome gift, as the long-awaited dacha season will start much earlier. For people with weather-related health issues, the rapid temperature fluctuations may pose a significant challenge. As a result, it is essential to be prepared for the unusual consequences of this early summer. This spring once again highlights the global climate changes that have affected even our familiar weather patterns.
Original language: ru
Publish date: March 17, 2025 05:31 PM
Source:[ngzt.ru](https://ngzt.ru/news/anomalnaya-zhara-nagryanet-v-aprele-leto-nastupit-na-dva-mesyaca-ranshe-rasskazal-sinoptik/)

**Spring Weather Forecast: Sunny and Warm, with Occasional Rain Showers**
The upcoming days will bring the beginning of spring, with temperatures expected to rise to 15 degrees Celsius. However, before that, there may be some snow showers on Monday, especially in the south and north of the country. On Tuesday, it will be mostly sunny, but with some clouds and occasional rain showers in the east and north. The temperature will range from -3 to 6 degrees Celsius, with a strong wind on the coast. From Wednesday to Thursday, it will be sunny and warmer, with temperatures ranging from 7 to 11 degrees Celsius. On Friday, the first day of spring, there will be a change in the weather, with increasing cloudiness and occasional rain showers. Temperatures will range from 10 to 15 degrees Celsius, with cooler temperatures near the coast. The weekend will be cloudy, with occasional rain showers, and temperatures ranging from 5 to 12 degrees Celsius. 'It will be a pleasant weekend, but we should be prepared for some rain showers,' said the meteorologist. 'The temperature will be around 10-14 degrees Celsius, with a moderate wind.' 
Original language: pl
Publish date: March 17, 2025 01:47 PM
Source:[rmf24.pl](https://www.rmf24.pl/pogoda/news-jakie-beda-pierwsze-dni-wiosny-jest-nowa-prognoza,nId,7932412)

**Severe Weather System Brings Extreme Conditions to US**
A severe weather system that affected the southern and midwestern United States over the weekend has moved east, bringing new extreme weather conditions. At least 40 people died in the storms, which caused widespread destruction in several states. The National Weather Service (NWS) reported that 557 storms were recorded on Friday, with 32 confirmed tornadoes. On Saturday, 135 storms were reported, with 34 confirmed tornadoes. The NWS warns of a new wave of extreme weather conditions, including thunderstorms and heavy snowfall in the western and northern parts of the country. In contrast, the central and eastern regions will experience unusually high temperatures. However, this warm weather will be accompanied by the risk of severe thunderstorms and tornadoes. Additionally, a high risk of wildfires is forecasted in the central and southern high plains due to strong winds, low humidity, and dry vegetation. The eastern and southeastern regions will experience relatively stable conditions, with scattered rain showers and light snowfall. The NWS has issued a hazardous weather outlook for the Miami and Melbourne offices, warning of a high risk of rip currents and strong winds along the Atlantic coast and in southern Florida.
Original language: es
Publish date: March 17, 2025 01:31 PM
Source:[La Nacion](https://www.lanacion.com.ar/estados-unidos/clima-en-estados-unidos-este-lunes-17-de-marzo-tormentas-severas-nevadas-intensas-y-florida-en-nid17032025/)

**Miami Weather Forecast for Sunday, March 16**
The weather forecast for Miami on Sunday, March 16, indicates a high temperature of 82°F (28°C) with a 25% chance of rain and scattered clouds. Wind gusts are expected to reach 17.4 mph during the day and 11.18 mph at night. The temperature will drop to 72°F (22°C) at night with a 57% chance of precipitation and more clouds than clear skies. The 'feels-like' temperature is expected to be around 90°F (32°C) both day and night. The sunrise is at 07:29 h and sunset at 19:30 h, with 12 hours of sunlight throughout the day. For Monday, the forecast indicates a cloudy sky with a 44% chance of thunderstorms and rain, with temperatures ranging from 57 to 79°F (14 to 26°C). The National Weather Service and AccuWeather predict a 44% chance of precipitation on Monday. According to the National Weather Service, the wettest season in Miami is from late spring to summer, with the driest periods being autumn and winter. The graph below shows that August and September are the months with the most rainfall in the city. Miami's climate is envied by many other cities, with mild winters and not-too-hot summers, although the humidity in the warmer months is high, making the 'feels-like' temperature even higher. The hottest period of the year occurs in August, with temperatures reaching 87.3°F (30.7°C), while the coldest period is in January, with temperatures dropping to 61.0°F (16.1°C).
Original language: es
Publish date: March 16, 2025 10:00 AM
Source:[La Opinión Digital](https://laopinion.com/2025/03/16/pronostico-del-tiempo-en-miami-para-este-domingo-16-de-marzo/)

**Miami Weather Forecast for March 11, 2025**
The weather forecast for Miami on Tuesday, March 11, indicates a high temperature of 77°F (25°C) with a 2% chance of rain and clear skies. Wind gusts are expected to reach 12.43 mph during the day and 8.08 mph at night. The temperature will drop to 59°F (15°C) at night. The 'feels-like' temperature is expected to be around 77°F (25°C) throughout the day. The sunrise is at 07:34 h and sunset is at 19:28 h, with 12 hours of sunlight. Tomorrow, the forecast predicts clear skies with temperatures ranging from 64 to 79°F (18 to 26°C). For a 7-day weather forecast, please check our website. According to the National Weather Service, Miami's wettest season is at the end of spring and summer, while autumn and winter are the driest periods. The graph below shows that August and September are the months with the most precipitation. Miami's climate is mild, with warm winters and not too hot summers, but high humidity during the hottest months makes the 'feels-like' temperature even higher. The warmest month is August, with temperatures reaching 87.3°F (30.7°C), while the coldest month is January, with temperatures dropping to 61.0°F (16.1°C).
Original language: es
Publish date: March 11, 2025 10:01 AM
Source:[La Opinión Digital](https://laopinion.com/2025/03/11/miami-el-tiempo-para-hoy-martes-11-de-marzo/)

**Miami Weather Forecast for Saturday, March 8**
Miami's weather forecast for Saturday, March 8, indicates a high temperature of 81°F (27°C) and a low of 68°F (20°C). The heat index, or 'real temperature', is expected to be 84°F (29°C) throughout the day. The sun rises at 6:38 am and sets at 6:26 pm, providing 12 hours of sunlight. Tomorrow, the weather is expected to be clear with temperatures ranging from 70 to 82°F (21 to 28°C). According to the National Weather Service, the chances of precipitation tomorrow are 1%. The rainy season in Miami typically occurs from late spring to summer, while the dry season occurs during autumn and winter. August is the hottest month, with temperatures often reaching 87.3°F (30.7°C), while January is the coolest, with temperatures often dropping to 61.0°F (16.1°C).
Original language: es
Publish date: March 08, 2025 11:03 AM
Source:[La Opinión Digital](https://laopinion.com/2025/03/08/miami-pronostico-del-tiempo-para-este-sabado-8-de-marzo/)

**Miami Weather Forecast: Rain Expected on Monday**
According to forecasts, the temperature will reach a high of 76 degrees Fahrenheit and a low of 67 degrees on Monday in Miami. The morning is expected to be cloudy, but rain showers are expected to start around midday and continue into the afternoon. We will provide information on the areas in southern Florida where the precipitation is most concentrated.
Original language: es
Publish date: February 24, 2025 12:16 AM
Source:[Univision](https://www.univision.com/local/miami-wltv/alista-el-paraguas-conoce-el-pronostico-del-tiempo-para-este-lunes-en-miami-video)

**First, there's near record heat. Then comes the weekend chill. How cold will Miami get?**
A cold front is expected to bring a significant drop in temperature to South Florida, with lows ranging from 56 to 59 degrees Fahrenheit on Friday morning. CBS News Miami meteorologist Lissette Gonzalez forecasts highs in the mid-70s on Friday, a significant drop from the near-record highs of 85 degrees in Miami and 84 degrees in Fort Lauderdale on Wednesday. 'The warmest day of the week,' Gonzalez said. The National Weather Service has issued an elevated risk of rip currents due to the cold front, and rain chances will increase to 30% on Sunday and Monday. By the weekend, temperatures are expected to dip to the upper-60s in the mornings and rise to around 75 degrees in the afternoons.
Original language: en
Publish date: February 19, 2025 09:45 PM
Source:[FLKeysNews.com - Website for The Reporter and The Keynoter newspapers](https://www.flkeysnews.com/news/weather-news/article300598769.html)

**Miami could see near record heat, cool down coming this weekend**
Miami is expected to experience near-record heat on Wednesday with a forecast high of 85 degrees, just 2 degrees shy of the current record of 87 degrees set in 1982. However, a strong cold front will move in late Thursday night, bringing cooler temperatures and sweater weather by Friday morning, with temperatures tumbling to the mid to upper 50s. The weekend will see a cool start on Saturday with temperatures in the low 60s, followed by a comfortable and sunny Sunday with highs in the upper 70s. The chance of rain is low on Thursday and Friday, but will increase on Sunday with the potential for scattered showers.
Original language: en
Publish date: February 19, 2025 01:31 PM
Source:[CBS News](https://www.cbsnews.com/miami/news/miami-weather-near-record-heat-cool-down-weekend/)

**Mostly sunny South Florida, near record heat possible**
South Florida is expected to experience near record heat on Thursday, with highs reaching the low to mid 80s under mostly sunny skies. The CBS Miami NEXT Weather team forecasts a high of 84 degrees in Miami, which is close to the current record of 86 degrees set in 1982. The weekend will be warm and breezy, with highs above normal in the low 80s on Saturday and the mid 80s on Sunday. Cooler, drier air will arrive by Monday for Presidents Day, with lows falling to the mid to upper 60s and highs returning to seasonable levels in the upper 70s.
Original language: en
Publish date: February 13, 2025 01:45 PM
Source:[CBS News](https://www.cbsnews.com/miami/news/mostly-sunny-south-florida-near-record-heat-possible/)

**Partly Cloudy with a Chance of Rain in South Florida on Monday**
According to the weather forecast, Miami's temperature is expected to reach highs of 81 degrees Fahrenheit and lows of 70 degrees throughout the day. The morning is expected to be pleasant, despite some cloudiness. However, there is a possibility of rain in some areas by the afternoon. 'The conditions are expected to be pleasant, but we can't rule out the possibility of rain in some zones by the afternoon,' said the weather forecast. 
Original language: es
Publish date: February 09, 2025 11:47 PM
Source:[Univision](https://www.univision.com/local/miami-wltv/algo-de-nubosidad-y-momentos-soleados-para-este-lunes-en-el-sur-de-florida-se-esperan-lluvias-video)

**Miami Weather Forecast for Sunday, February 9th**
The weather forecast for Miami, Florida on Sunday, February 9th indicates a high of 81°F (27°C) with a 41% chance of rain and partly cloudy skies. Wind gusts will reach up to 8.08 mph during the day and 6.84 mph at night. The temperature will drop to 68°F (20°C) at night with a 2% chance of precipitation and light cloud cover. The heat index, or 'real temperature', is expected to be around 84°F (29°C) throughout the day. The sunrise will occur at 7:00 am and sunset at 6:10 pm, providing 11 hours of sunlight. Tomorrow's forecast is expected to be mostly sunny with temperatures ranging from 72 to 79°F (22 to 26°C). The chances of precipitation tomorrow are 2%. According to the National Weather Service, the wettest season in Miami occurs from late spring to summer, while the dry season occurs from late fall to winter. The months of August and September are the wettest months in Miami, with temperatures often reaching 87.3°F (30.7°C) in August and 61.0°F (16.1°C) in January.
Original language: es
Publish date: February 09, 2025 11:03 AM
Source:[La Opinión Digital](https://laopinion.com/2025/02/09/miami-pronostico-del-tiempo-para-este-domingo-9-de-febrero/)

**South Florida experiencing nice, warm weather ahead of Super Bowl weekend**
South Florida is experiencing warm and dry weather ahead of Super Bowl weekend, with highs in the lower 80s each day. A stray shower is possible in the early afternoon hours of Sunday, but most areas will remain rain-free. The warm weather is expected to continue into next week, with highs ranging from four to six degrees above average, and temperatures topping off in the 80s each day. By Thursday and Valentine's Day, highs are expected to climb into the middle 80s, making it feel like late April by the end of the week, according to CBS News Miami's NEXT Weather Meteorologist K.C. Sherman.
Original language: en
Publish date: February 08, 2025 06:36 PM
Source:[CBS News](https://www.cbsnews.com/miami/news/south-florida-experiencing-nice-warm-weather-ahead-of-super-bowl-weekend/)

**Miami Weather Forecast for Saturday, January 25**
The weather forecast for Miami, Florida on Saturday, January 25 indicates a high of 72°F (22°C) and a low of 63°F (17°C). The chance of precipitation is 1% and there will be a mix of clouds and clear skies. The wind speed will be around 10.56 mph. The 'real feel' temperature, or the temperature that people will experience, is expected to be around 70°F (21°C) throughout the day. The sunrise will be at 7:07 am and the sunset will be at 5:59 pm, with 11 hours of sunshine. For tomorrow, the forecast indicates a mix of clouds and clear skies with temperatures ranging from 64°F to 73°F (18°C to 23°C). The chance of precipitation tomorrow is 1%. According to the National Weather Service, the wettest season in Miami is from late spring to summer, while the driest periods are autumn and winter. The hottest month in Miami is August, with temperatures reaching up to 87.3°F (30.7°C), while the coldest month is January, with temperatures ranging from 61.0°F (16.1°C).
Original language: es
Publish date: January 25, 2025 11:00 AM
Source:[La Opinión Digital](https://laopinion.com/2025/01/25/miami-el-tiempo-para-hoy-sabado-25-de-enero/)

**You think it's cold now? Here's how much colder it will get in Miami and across Florida**
A cold front has moved through South Florida, plunging temperatures into the weekend. The National Weather Service in Miami predicts wind chills ranging from the 30s in parts of the interior and Southwest Florida to low- to mid-40s along the east coast. Patchy frost may develop across interior locations west of Lake Okeechobee Friday and Saturday mornings, with temperatures in that region reaching low- to mid-30s. Temperatures in the Miami area will see highs only reaching the mid-60s Thursday, around 60 on Friday, and 69 on Saturday. The cold weather will resume on Sunday and Monday, with highs reaching low- to mid-70s. Robert Molleda, the National Weather Service in Miami's weather coordination meteorologist, warns of a high risk of rip currents along Atlantic Beaches through the weekend and hazardous marine conditions through Saturday. Weather Underground predicts the coldest temperatures to be in Fort Lauderdale (47°F with a 'feels-like' low of 43) and Gainesville (29°F with a 'feels-like' low of 29) on Saturday morning.
Original language: en
Publish date: January 23, 2025 07:34 PM
Source:[ArcaMax](https://www.arcamax.com/knowledge/weather/weathernews/s-3569721)

**A cold and 'dreary' week is in store for South Florida as winter presses on**
A cool and 'dreary' week is expected for South Florida, with temperatures ranging from the mid-70s to the mid-40s. According to George Rizzuto, a meteorologist with the National Weather Service of Miami, scattered showers are expected until Wednesday, followed by a cold front that will drop high temperatures to the upper 60s and low 70s. The coldest temperatures are expected late Friday night and Saturday morning, with some areas seeing temperatures in the mid-40s. Rizzuto notes that it's possible to still get strong cold fronts through the rest of the winter, particularly in January and February. 'Cloud coverage will allow for mild high temperatures, with many locations struggling to reach 70 degrees,' the NWS Miami forecast states. If Friday sees highs only in the 60s, it would be the coolest high temperatures the region has seen so far this year, Rizzuto said.
Original language: en
Publish date: January 21, 2025 04:55 PM
Source:[SunSentinel](https://www.sun-sentinel.com/2025/01/21/a-cold-and-dreary-week-is-in-store-for-south-florida-as-winter-presses-on/)

**A weather roller coaster": Miami temperatures to bounce around warm to cold this week**
South Florida can expect a 'weather roller coaster' this week, with temperatures fluctuating from warm to cold. According to Sammy Hadi, a meteorologist at the National Weather Service's Miami office, 'it is going to be a week that starts off wet with showers at times, then with two cold fronts Wednesday and Friday night.' Temperatures are projected to be in the mid to upper 70s on Tuesday, but will drop to the upper 60s on Wednesday and Thursday, and could be in the upper 50s on Friday morning and the middle 60s during the daytime. Residents should remain vigilant, as temperatures on Saturday morning are likely to be in the upper 40s. While it may snow in cities further north in the state, South Florida residents should still be prepared for a cold Friday and Saturday morning.
Original language: en
Publish date: January 20, 2025 09:34 PM
Source:[Miami Herald](https://www.miamiherald.com/news/weather/article298855963.html)

**Miami Weather Forecast for Sunday, January 19**
According to the weather forecast for Miami, Florida, on Sunday, January 19, the temperature is expected to reach a maximum of 82°F (28°C) with a 3% chance of rain. The wind gusts will be around 13.67 mph during the day and 8.08 mph at night. The temperature at night will be around 61°F (16°C) with a 55% chance of precipitation and cloudy skies. The estimated 'feels-like' temperature will be 84°F (29°C) during the day and 84°F (29°C) at night. The sunrise will be at 07:09 h and sunset at 17:55 h, with 11 hours of sunlight. For tomorrow, the forecast indicates cloudy skies with a 84% chance of rain and temperatures ranging from 66°F to 68°F (19°C to 20°C). The Service Meteorológico Nacional de Estados Unidos and AccuWeather predict that the wettest season in Miami is from the end of spring to summer, while the end of autumn and winter are drier. The months of August and September are the wettest months, with high humidity and a 'feels-like' temperature of 87.3°F (30.7°C) in August and 61.0°F (16.1°C) in January.
Original language: es
Publish date: January 19, 2025 11:00 AM
Source:[La Opinión Digital](https://laopinion.com/2025/01/19/miami-el-tiempo-para-hoy-domingo-19-de-enero/)

phase_1_result.initial_reasoning: Historically, Miami, FL has experienced temperatures of 90 degrees Fahrenheit or higher primarily during the late spring, summer, and early fall months. According to climatological data, the first instance of temperatures reaching this mark in a given year usually starts in April. Given this is late March, the frequency is typically low but not impossible. The base rate for Miami to reach such a temperature this early in the year can be estimated around 15%.

perspective_derived_factors.name: Recent Temperature Trends
perspective_derived_factors.reasoning: Review of recent weather patterns and forecast models can show warming trends or expected near-term weather shifts. If recent weather models suggest unusually high temperatures for this period in March, this could increase the likelihood of reaching 90 degrees.

perspective_derived_factors.name: Climate Change Impact
perspective_derived_factors.reasoning: The effect of climate change has resulted in more frequent temperature anomalies and record-setting temperatures globally. This might elevate the potential for Miami to experience unusually high temperatures even earlier in the year.

perspective_derived_factors.name: Local Weather Systems
perspective_derived_factors.reasoning: Examining current upper air patterns, such as high-pressure systems which can lead to heatwaves, will affect local temperatures significantly. If there is a significant high-pressure system, it could drive the temperatures upward.

perspective_derived_factors.name: Historical Data for March
perspective_derived_factors.reasoning: Historically, the occurrence of 90-degree temperatures in March in Miami is rare. While trends may change, historical occurrences provide a dampening effect unless significantly different forecasts are present.

analysis_updates.points_reinforcing_prior_analysis: Some reports suggest that South Florida will experience warmer temperatures, particularly on Thursday, with highs in the mid-80s. This aligns with the increasing temperature trend and supports a slight increase in the probability of reaching 90°F before April.
